item.title: IND vs AUS: Rohit Sharma likely to open in Boxing Day Test vs Australia at MCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Set to Open in Boxing Day Test Against Australia

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Times of India

Indian captain Rohit Sharma is likely to open the batting for India in the upcoming Boxing Day Test against Australia at the MCG, affecting KL Rahul's position in the batting order.

  • Rohit Sharma is expected to return to the top of the order in the Test starting on Thursday.
  • KL Rahul will move to the No.3 slot in batting order.
  • Rohit is coming off a series of underwhelming performances but is ready to contribute.
  • The weather conditions in Melbourne are unpredictable, potentially influencing team strategy regarding spinners.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1, making this a crucial match for both teams.
“Let’s not worry about who bats where. Something that we need to figure and not something I would be discussing here. We will do what is best for the team.” - Rohit Sharma

This Test will be pivotal for India, with a large crowd expected, as they aim to gain an advantage in the closely contested series.

item.title: IND vs AUS: Rohit Sharma likely to open in Boxing Day Test, KL Rahul at No. 3 - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Set to Open in Boxing Day Test Against Australia

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Times of India

Indian captain Rohit Sharma is likely to open the batting for India in the upcoming Boxing Day Test against Australia at the MCG, affecting KL Rahul's position in the batting order.

  • Rohit Sharma is expected to return to the top of the order in the Test starting on Thursday.
  • KL Rahul will move to the No.3 slot in batting order.
  • Rohit is coming off a series of underwhelming performances but is ready to contribute.
  • The weather conditions in Melbourne are unpredictable, potentially influencing team strategy regarding spinners.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1, making this a crucial match for both teams.
“Let’s not worry about who bats where. Something that we need to figure and not something I would be discussing here. We will do what is best for the team.” - Rohit Sharma

This Test will be pivotal for India, with a large crowd expected, as they aim to gain an advantage in the closely contested series.

item.title: Vinod Kambli health concerns: From brain clots, heart ailments to urine infection, what all is affecting former cricketer - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli health concerns: From brain clots, heart ailments to urine infection, what all is affecting former cricketer

Publication Date: Unavailable - Source: India.com

Former cricketer Vinod Kambli is facing multiple health issues, including brain clots, heart ailments, and a urinary infection. This summary explores the extent of his medical challenges and their impact on his life.

  • Kambli has been diagnosed with brain clots causing significant health concerns.
  • Heart ailments have exacerbated his overall health condition.
  • Recent reports indicate a urinary infection that requires treatment.
"Health is wealth, and it is something we often take for granted until it is at stake."

The array of health issues facing Vinod Kambli highlights the importance of regular health check-ups and a healthy lifestyle.

item.title: Australia Name Playing XI For Boxing Day Test Against India, Make 2 Huge Changes - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Australia Names Playing XI for Boxing Day Test Against India

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Australia has announced their playing XI for the Boxing Day Test match against India, which starts on Thursday, featuring two significant changes to the lineup.

  • Scott Boland replaces the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Teenager Sam Konstas will debut, taking Nathan McSweeney's place.
  • Travis Head has recovered from a minor thigh strain and is fit to play.
“Trav is good to go, so he will play. No stress, no worries about injury for Trav.” - Pat Cummins

The five-match series is currently tied 1-1, following a win for India and a decisive victory for Australia.

item.title: "I Am MVP Of My Cricket, Not Rohit Sharma Or Virat Kohli": Ravichandran Ashwin - NDTV Sports
item.description:
I Am MVP Of My Cricket, Not Rohit Sharma Or Virat Kohli: Ravichandran Ashwin

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Ravichandran Ashwin, after his retirement from international cricket, emphasizes the significance of the team sport over individual accolades. He reflects on the perceptions surrounding his personality in cricket and asserts his self-worth as the MVP in his own cricketing journey.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement, receiving widespread tributes.
  • He interacts with former England captains Atherton and Hussain to discuss cricketing myths.
  • Ashwin aims to shed light on misconceptions about his seriousness on the field.
  • He emphasizes the unique journeys of individual players and asserts his place as MVP of his own cricket story.
“In my life, for my dad or for my mom, I am the MVP. It's not Rohit, Virat or somebody on the outside.”

Ashwin’s reflections invite a broader appreciation of all players in cricket, championing the idea that every individual's journey is unique and valuable.

item.title: All pace and no spin? Selection dilemma follows Pakistan to Centurion - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Pakistan's Selection Challenge Ahead of Test Match in Centurion

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

The Pakistan cricket team faces a critical selection dilemma as they prepare for their upcoming Test match in Centurion, contrasting with their recent experience in Rawalpindi where they struggled without a specialist spinner.

  • The weather in Centurion has improved to a crisp summer breeze, differing greatly from the hot conditions in Rawalpindi.
  • Pakistan is evaluating their team composition for the Boxing Day Test, particularly whether to include a specialist spinner.
  • Recent history shows a tactical misstep for Pakistan when they fielded an all-pace attack against Bangladesh, leading to defeat.
  • South Africa also seems likely to field an all-pace attack due to fitness concerns over spinner Keshav Maharaj.
  • Key player Saud Shakeel emphasized the need for careful consideration before finalizing the squad.

“The pitch looks like it has a lot of moisture, but there's a couple of days left still before the start of the Test, so let's see how the pitch looks then.”Saud Shakeel

The decision on team composition is critical, as past experiences illustrate the risks involved with misjudging pitch conditions, making the selection process both urgent and high-stakes.

item.title: Celebrate 2024 And Vote For This Year's Chess.com Awards - Chess.com
item.description:
Celebrate 2024 And Vote For This Year's Chess.com Awards

item.title: Ajith Kumar, Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, Mrunal Thakur attend PV Sindhu-Venkata Datta Sai's wedding reception. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Celebrities Attend PV Sindhu's Wedding Reception with Venkata Datta Sai

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

P.V. Sindhu married businessman Venkata Datta Sai in Udaipur, followed by a grand wedding reception in Hyderabad attended by numerous film celebrities.

  • Ajith Kumar attended looking sharp in a black suit.
  • Nagarjuna and Chiranjeevi were also present, showcasing their stylish looks.
  • Mrunal Thakur dazzled in a beautiful lehenga at the reception.
P.V. Sindhu shared wedding photos on social media, captioning them with a heart emoji.

The event celebrated love and celebrity camaraderie, highlighting the joy surrounding Sindhu's new journey.

item.title: "I am the MVP and not Rohit, Virat": Ravichandran Ashwin speaks up against the trend of labelling other players as support cast - Crictoday
item.description:
“I am the MVP and not Rohit, Virat”: Ravichandran Ashwin speaks up against the trend of labelling other players as support cast

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Crictoday

Ravichandran Ashwin, the second-highest wicket-taker for India, has voiced his concerns over the labeling of players as support cast, stressing the importance of recognizing every player’s contribution in cricket as a team sport.

  • Ashwin took 765 wickets for India across formats.
  • He criticized the narrative that sidelines players like him in favor of star players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
  • Ashwin declared himself the 'MVP' of his own career, highlighting the personal significance of this title for him and his family.
  • Despite retiring from international cricket, Ashwin will continue his career with Chennai Super Kings in the IPL.
“I am the MVP in my life. For my mom and dad, I am the MVP. It is not Rohit, Virat or somebody as everyone’s journey is unique.”

Ashwin's statements bring attention to the broader discourse around the narrative of cricket, advocating for recognition of all players’ vital roles in the sport.

item.title: Vinod Kambli 'Stable' After Major Health Scare, Receives Rs 5 Lakh Aid From... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Vinod Kambli 'Stable' After Major Health Scare, Receives Rs 5 Lakh Aid

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Former India cricketer Vinod Kambli is recovering in the ICU after being hospitalized for a urinary tract infection. His condition is now stable, and he has received financial aid for his treatment.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital with a severe urinary tract infection.
  • His condition was critical four days prior due to pus accumulation in his bladder, which was removed upon hospitalization.
  • Doctors are planning an MRI to investigate brain clots after medical examinations.
  • Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, along with his MP-son Shrikant Shinde, provided assistance of Rs 5 lakh for Kambli's medical expenses.
Kambli expressed heartfelt gratitude to the state's leadership for their support during his health crisis.

Kambli's health is being closely monitored, and he may be discharged within a few days as he continues to recover.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Will Rohit Sharma and Usman Khawaja, Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant, finally stand up? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why is Boxing Day Test not a sacred tradition, but reflects power of marketing and Kerry Packer

Publication Date: December 25, 2023

Source: Indian Express

In Melbourne City, the festive atmosphere is vibrant as people prepare for the Boxing Day Test, yet beneath the excitement lies the truth: this event is shaped by marketing rather than tradition. Dr. Thomas Heenan from Monash University explains how the Boxing Day Test gained prominence only after Kerry Packer revolutionized cricket broadcasts.

  • The Boxing Day Test has become a staple of Australian culture but lacks historical tradition.
  • It was only after 1979, with Kerry Packer acquiring broadcast rights, that the event surged in popularity.
  • Initially, the day was reserved for other cricketing events, with minimal attendance until marketing strategies changed public perception.
  • The significance of Australia's historical oppponents, such as the West Indies and England, has evolved with the growing presence of Indian players.
  • Current team performance raises questions on batsmen's capabilities, highlighted by rookie challenges and pitch conditions.
“Boxing Day Test is a perfect example of the power of marketing,” says Dr Thomas Heenan.

This reflection on the Boxing Day Test reveals how cultural events can be crafted through marketing, showing that traditions can be shaped in modern times rather than handed down through generations.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Are India ready to make changes to ensure spearhead Jasprit Bumrah gets reinforcement? - The Times of India
item.description:
Boxing Day Test: Are India ready to make changes to ensure spearhead Jasprit Bumrah gets reinforcement?

Date: MELBOURNE

Source: Times of India

As India prepares for a critical fourth Test against Australia, discussions are underway regarding potential changes to their lineup to better support pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah. The team is contemplating the introduction of an additional pacer or spinner based on pitch conditions.

  • The Indian team is considering playing an extra pacer in light of pitch conditions favoring fast bowlers.
  • Rohit Sharma acknowledges the team's reliance on Bumrah's exceptional form.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy’s dual role as a lower-order batter and occasional medium-pacer is under scrutiny.
  • Rohit spoke about the challenges of utilizing their current squad effectively given their players' form.
"It's a challenge to handle not just the bowling but the entire team. When somebody is in form, we have to make the most of that." - Rohit Sharma

The outcome of this decision may play a pivotal role in determining the success of the series for India.

item.title: 'I don't think Virat Kohli is out of form' - says Ravi Shastri - The Times of India
item.description:
'I don't think Virat Kohli is out of form' - says Ravi Shastri

Publication Date: 2024-01-01 Source: Times of India

Former India coach Ravi Shastri shared insights on the performance of Virat Kohli and Steve Smith, suggesting that they are still dangerous players despite their recent struggles with form.

  • Ravi Shastri believes that Kohli and Smith are still capable of scoring big, as they are hungry for runs.
  • Shastri noted that players like Joe Root and Kane Williamson have outperformed Kohli and Smith this year.
  • Kohli has scored 376 runs in 9 matches this year, averaging 25.06, whereas Smith has 337 runs in 8 matches at an average of 28.08.
  • Both players have shown signs of returning to form in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, with each scoring a century.
“If Virat gets over that first 30-40 minutes with serious application and discipline, I don’t think he's (out of form), none of these guys are out of form.” - Ravi Shastri

In conclusion, despite their struggles, Kohli and Smith remain formidable players with the potential to impact upcoming matches.

item.title: AUS vs IND: Australia make Travis Head call, announce playing XI for Boxing Day Test - India Today
item.description:
Australia vs India, 4th Test: Australia make Travis Head call, announce playing XI for Boxing Day Test

Published On: Dec 25, 2024

Published By: Akshay Ramesh

Australia confirmed their playing XI for the fourth Test on Christmas, reinstating Travis Head following a groin injury concern and ensuring that teenager Sam Konstas makes his debut.

  • Travis Head passed a fitness test and will play in the Boxing Day Test after concerns from the third Test.
  • Sam Konstas, aged 19, will debut as one of Australia's youngest openers.
  • Mitchell Marsh remains in the playing XI despite speculation about his form and fitness.
  • Scott Boland returns in place of the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Australia aims for an aggressive opening stand with Konstas and Usman Khawaja.
“Trav (Head) is good to go, he'll play… no worries about injury with Trav.” - Pat Cummins

This match marks a crucial point in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy as Australia looks to capitalize on Head's presence and Konstas's promising talent.

item.title: 'I shouldn't have gone to the Olympics and won medals for the country': Manu Bhaker devastated by Khel Ratna axe - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Manu Bhaker Heartbroken Over Khel Ratna Exclusion

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Indian shooter Manu Bhaker, who won multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, expressed devastation upon learning that she was not shortlisted for the prestigious Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna award, despite her remarkable achievements.

  • Manu Bhaker won bronze medals in both individual and mixed 10m air pistol events at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
  • She has accumulated 17 gold, 6 silver, and 5 bronze medals across various competitions since the Tokyo Olympics.
  • Despite her achievements, only two athletes from the Indian Olympic contingent were shortlisted for the Khel Ratna award.
  • Her father revealed her disappointment, stating she regretted competing for the country.
  • The decision faced backlash from fans, prompting discussions for reconsideration by the sports ministry.
"I shouldn't have gone to the Olympics and won medals for the country. In fact, I shouldn't have become a sportsperson." - Manu Bhaker

The exclusion of such a prominent athlete from recognition has sparked significant public outrage, highlighting ongoing disparities in the acknowledgment of sporting achievements in India.

item.title: Travis Head declared fit as Australia reveal playing XI for Boxing Day Test against India in Melbourne - The Times of India
item.description:
Travis Head Fit for Boxing Day Test Against India

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Travis Head has passed a fitness test and will play in the Boxing Day Test against India at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Australian captain Pat Cummins confirmed that Head is fully fit after concerns about a quad strain.

  • Head's fitness was under question after a quad strain during the third Test in Brisbane.
  • Sam Konstas will make his Test debut, replacing Nathan McSweeney.
  • Scott Boland returns to the team for the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Head is currently the leading run-scorer in the series with 409 runs at an average of 81.80, including two centuries.
“It feels like the last 12 months, he’s been in this unbelievable vein of form and he just keeps going on with it.” - Pat Cummins

The five-Test series is finely balanced at 1-1 after three matches, making this Boxing Day Test critical for both teams.

item.title: Enzo Fernández ‘feeling very good’ at Chelsea these days - We Ain't Got No History
item.description:
Enzo Fernández Thriving at Chelsea as He Approaches Second Anniversary

Date: October 2023 | Source: ESPN

Enzo Fernández is entering his second year at Chelsea on a high note, showing renewed vigor and influence on the pitch after overcoming injury challenges.

  • Enzo Fernández reflects on his time at Chelsea, particularly the difficulties of the last season.
  • He acknowledges the support from coaching staff and a return to fitness has improved his performance.
  • Enzo's enhanced presence is vital for Chelsea's aspirations as they aim for title contention.
“When I arrived it was very difficult, the first year and a half here: change of coaches, the club wasn’t doing well, personal injuries. [The price tag] didn’t affect me. I tried to take it responsibly, with enjoyment, without pressure...”

Enzo's commitment and improved form are critical as Chelsea seeks to return to the top of the league.

item.title: The Bosch family live their dream as Corbin's big day arrives - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
The Bosch family celebrate Corbin's debut with a heartfelt tribute to their father

Date: Not specified Source: ESPNcricinfo

The Bosch family marks a significant milestone as Corbin Bosch makes his ODI debut, wearing his late father's 1992 World Cup shirt in a touching tribute. This moment reflects both personal and sporting heritage as Corbin prepares for his Test debut on Boxing Day.

  • Corbin wore his father Tertius' World Cup shirt during his ODI debut.
  • Corbin showcased impressive performance with bowling and batting during his debut match.
  • He has been named in South Africa's Test squad for the upcoming match at SuperSport Park, where his father once played.
  • Eathan Bosch, Corbin's brother, emphasized their mother's support in fostering their cricketing dreams.
  • Corbin expressed emotional thoughts on debuting at the same ground where his father began his career.
"I cannot wait to get onto this field in a couple days' time." - Corbin Bosch

Corbin Bosch's journey to this moment illustrates perseverance and familial bonds, demonstrating how sporting legacies continue to inspire new generations.

item.title: India to play Champions Trophy games in Dubai after refusal to visit Pakistan - The Guardian
item.description:
India to Play Champions Trophy Matches in Dubai Due to Political Tensions

Publication Date: Tuesday, Source: The Guardian

India's matches in the 2025 Champions Trophy will be held in Dubai after the country refused to visit Pakistan due to ongoing political tensions between the two nations.

  • The ICC confirmed that India will play in Dubai, the chosen neutral venue for their matches.
  • India’s fixtures include games against Bangladesh and New Zealand, as well as their Group A game against Pakistan.
  • If India qualifies for the final on March 9, it will be hosted in Dubai instead of Lahore.
  • This decision follows the Board of Control for Cricket in India’s announcement that it would not send a team to Pakistan, citing government advice.
  • The last time India toured Pakistan was in 2008, while Pakistan last played India in the 2023 World Cup.
  • The tournament marks the first Champions Trophy since 2017, which Pakistan won against India.
“We are pleased that an agreement has been reached based on the principles of equality and respect, showcasing the spirit of cooperation and collaboration that defines our sport,” - PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi.

The tournament is expected to be a major event, with Pakistan last hosting an ICC event in 1996.

item.title: Paris heartache over, Chanu focuses on regaining peak fitness - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Chanu Focuses on Fitness After Paris Olympics Heartbreak

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Mirabai Chanu has resumed training under national coach Vijay Sharma after narrowly missing out on a medal at the Paris Olympics, placing fourth. Despite the setback, she remains optimistic and focused on her recovery and future competitions.

  • Chanu recalls her fourth-place finish at the Paris Olympics, missing a medal by just 1kg.
  • She faced challenges including injuries and menstrual cramps during the competition.
  • Chanu achieved a lift of 199kg, which would have won a medal at the previous Olympics.
  • She is focusing on rebuilding her strength and has shifted her training base to Modinagar.
  • The athlete aims to prepare for future competitions, particularly the 2026 Asian Games.
“I know I need to raise my game if I am to win a medal in Los Angeles,” Chanu stated.

In conclusion, Mirabai Chanu's determination to bounce back from her Olympic disappointment showcases her resilience as she aims for future success in weightlifting.

item.title: PV Sindhu, Venkat Datta's official wedding pics are out: The bride stunned in sarees and lehengas - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PV Sindhu looked gorgeous in sarees and lehengas for her wedding festivities. More details inside.

Date: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

PV Sindhu and Venkat Datta’s first official wedding pictures are out. The Badminton star shared a series of pictures from the wedding ceremony on her Instagram profile and made her friends go aww. The sports star opted for sarees and lehengas from the houses of fashion designers Sabyasachi Mukherjee, Manish Malhotra and Papa Don’t Preach.

Key Points:

  • PV Sindhu wore a stunning ivory white saree for her wedding, heavily embellished with mirror details.
  • For another ritual, she opted for a bright red lehenga with silver embroidery.
  • She showcased a bright red kanjeevaram saree, further enhancing her look with matching accessories.
  • Her pastel pink lehenga featured contrasting gold embellishments and a unique hemline.
  • The couple celebrated their wedding privately, attended by close friends and family.
“Pleased to have attended the wedding ceremony of our Badminton Champion Olympian PV Sindhu with Venkat Datta Sai in Udaipur last evening.” - Gajendra Singh Shekhawat, Union Minister

In summary, PV Sindhu's wedding was a beautiful celebration featuring exquisite outfits, showcasing her stunning fashion choices and capturing the joy of the occasion.

item.title: What can Pakistan learn from their history of trauma in South Africa? - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
What Pakistan Can Learn from Their Historical Struggles in South Africa

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: ESPNcricinfo

Pakistan cricket has faced significant challenges in South Africa, reflecting a pattern of mental scarring similar to their struggles in Australia. Despite earlier defeats, the emotional toll of these matches has not been fully analyzed or addressed, leading to recurring failures in their performances.

  • Pakistan has lost 12 out of 13 Tests played in South Africa since 1995.
  • The team suffered a historical low, being bowled out for 49 runs in 2013.
  • Mickey Arthur highlights that South Africa generates pressure that often leads to Pakistan's downfall.
  • Pakistan's pace bowlers have historically underperformed in South African conditions.
  • Key players like Shaheen Afridi and Mushtaq Ahmed's insights suggest a need for adjustment in strategy and technique.

"I see so many teams being beaten by South Africa in the last session of the day. You lose a session badly, and there's no coming back from that"
Mickey Arthur

The current situation requires Pakistan to reassess their approach in South Africa, given their historical failures and the urgent need for improvement in forthcoming matches.

item.title: "Brain Condition Not Stable": Vinod Kambli's Latest Health Update Is Worrying, Doctor Says, "Plannin.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Brain Condition Not Stable": Vinod Kambli's Latest Health Update Is Worrying, Doctor Says, "Planning To..."

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Vinod Kambli, the former Indian cricketer, is currently hospitalized due to a worrying brain condition as reported by Dr. Vivek Dwivedi. Kambli was admitted following symptoms including muscle cramps and dizziness.

  • Kambli's brain condition is reported as unstable, with degenerative changes observed.
  • He was admitted with a high-grade fever, muscle cramps, and difficulty walking.
  • Medical examination revealed a urine infection and deficiencies in sodium and potassium.
  • A brain scan indicated old clots, likely from a recent stroke.
  • Kambli is expected to be discharged in 2-3 days if his condition stabilizes.
Dr. Vivek Dwivedi stated, "While his vitals are stable, his treatment and physiotherapy continue. We are prioritizing his rehabilitation."

Kambli expressed gratitude for the support from his friend, Sachin Tendulkar, stating, "I feel better now. I will never leave cricket because I remember the centuries and double centuries I have scored."

The situation underscores the importance of health monitoring and rehabilitation for athletes post-career.

item.title: PV Sindhu shares magical wedding moments, dazzles in breathtaking photos - The Times of India
item.description:
PV Sindhu shares magical wedding moments, dazzles in breathtaking photos

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Times of India

This article highlights the enchanting wedding of PV Sindhu, showcasing her stunning photos and updates from the event.

  • PV Sindhu, a prominent Indian badminton player, recently tied the knot.
  • Exclusive pictures showcase Sindhu in exquisite bridal attire.
  • The wedding ceremony was attended by close family and friends, celebrating a significant milestone in her life.
“The moments were magical and filled with love,” said a close friend of the couple.

This wedding marks a joyous occasion for Sindhu, adding to her list of achievements both on and off the court.

item.title: "You don't see me pushing across a kiss to my better half" - Ravichandran Ashwin reacts to being termed a serious personality - Sportskeeda
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin Responds to Perceptions of Seriousness After Retirement Announcement

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Sportskeeda

Ravichandran Ashwin, following his retirement from international cricket, addressed the notion that he is a serious personality, attributing it to his reserved celebrations compared to his peers.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement after the third Test of the India-Australia series.
  • He is the seventh-highest wicket-taker in Test history, with 537 wickets.
  • He expressed that his demeanor on the field might mislead fans into perceiving him as serious.
  • Ashwin emphasized that he has always viewed himself as the most valuable player (MVP) in his cricket journey.
“I wanted people to know me for who I am… Ashwin's picking up a wicket and Virat Kohli is all over the place.”

He highlighted the importance of recognizing every player's journey and contributions, not just the celebrated legends.
